com.teamdev.jxbrowser.chromium

Class JSFunction

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.teamdev.jxbrowser.chromium.JSValue
      • com.teamdev.jxbrowser.chromium.JSObject
        • com.teamdev.jxbrowser.chromium.JSFunction

  • public class JSFunction
extends JSObject
    Represents a JavaScript function. JavaScript function always belongs to a JSObject instance.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      void invoke(JSObject instance, JSValue... args)
      Executes JavaScript function asynchronously.
      JSValue invokeAndReturnValue(JSObject instance, JSValue... args)
      Executes JavaScript function and returns result of execution as JSValue.

    • Method Detail

      • invoke

        public void invoke(JSObject instance,
                   JSValue... args)
        Executes JavaScript function asynchronously. It means that this method doesn't block current thread execution and ignores return value. If function execution raises an exception and you need to get information about this exception, then use ConsoleListener. All unexpected exceptions during function execution can be accessible via ConsoleListener like other JavaScript errors.
        Parameters:
        instance - represents JSObject instance which is owner of the current function. If function represents a global JavaScript function, then you should use null. The instance must belong to the same JavaScript execution context as the current function.
        args - input arguments.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when instance is a valid JavaScript object, but it belongs to a different JavaScript execution context. The instance must be running in the same execution context as the current function.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when function is already disposed or its JavaScript execution context isn't available anymore.

      • invokeAndReturnValue

        public JSValue invokeAndReturnValue(JSObject instance,
                                    JSValue... args)
        Executes JavaScript function and returns result of execution as JSValue. This method blocks current thread execution until JavaScript function finishes its execution. If JavaScript function raises an exception, then JSFunctionException with error message that describes the reason of exception will be thrown. Same error message will be printed in JavaScript Console, so you can get using ConsoleListener.
        Parameters:
        instance - represents JSObject instance which is owner of the current function. If function represents a global JavaScript function, then you should use null. The instance must belong to the same JavaScript execution context as the current function.
        args - input arguments.
        Returns:
        result of JavaScript function execution. Never returns null.
        Throws:
        JSFunctionException - when exception occurs during function execution.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when instance is a valid JavaScript object, but it belongs to a different JavaScript execution context. The instance must be running in the same execution context as the current function.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when instance is already disposed or its JavaScript execution context isn't available anymore.
